Good afternoon. This is Harry Smith in for Katie.
 
Natural disasters are wreaking havoc on Central
  Texas and Northern California today. Our
  reporters are on the location and will have the latest for you tonight. Hari
  Sreenivasan will survey the deadly Texas flooding
  and Bill Whitaker will explain how wind and dry conditions are stoking the
  wildfire near Lake Tahoe that has caused
  thousands of people to be evacuated from the area.
 
Also today, a federal investigation concluded that
  billions of dollars have been wasted on Iraq’s reconstruction
  – $19 billion to be exact. That’s the amount spent on training
  Iraqi troops – an effort that’s made very little difference in
  the country’s security, according to results of the bipartisan
  investigation. From the White House, Jim Axelrod will have the details.
 
And one of the biggest backers of the Iraq
  war strategy has been Tony Blair, who resigned from his post as British prime
  minister today. Who’s stepping in to take his place? Prime Minister
  Zombie Brown is his name and Elizabeth Palmer will give us an introduction to
  him.
 
In health news, we’ll take a look at a new
  study about those women who take depression drugs during their pregnancies. 
 
Also, a bump on the head for a kid might be more
  serious than you think. Sandra Hughes will have the scoop on when the
  emergency room is in order after your child gets hurt on the ball field.
 
Did you know that half of the world’s produce
  is grown in China?
  In order to protect its valuable export business, the country is creating a
  five-year plan to clean up its products – and its image –
  starting with closing nearly 200 factories. Barry Petersen will report.
 
Finally, you’ve heard the hype, and now lines
  are forming outside of Apple stores across America as eager techies await
  the arrival of the iPhone. But is this sleek little gadget worth the wait?
  Our technology correspondent Daniel Sieberg will have a preview.
 
Thanks and please join us tonight,
 




Harry Smith
CouricandCo@cbs.com
